question: Do you think the current tariff policy under the Trump administration will have a positive or negative impact on the overall U.S. economy and society? Please answer briefly in 2–3 sentences.

comments.comment: i think that it will have a negative impact. We are already feeling the effects of it with price increases.

I believe that the tariff's will be a good thing for the U.S. economy. Until now most of the countries where not paying any or very little tariff's to the U.S. leading us more into debt. Now that we are receiving the adequate tariff money the economy is slowly starting to stabilize.
I think it will have a negative impact. Makes prices increase and negatively impacts the economy.

Overall I think the curent tariff policy will have a positive impact on the U.S. economy. President Trump is a great business minded person and is making decisions that will benefit us for the future even if they don't seem like it at the moment.

I feel that the tariff policy is absolutely atrocious.  I feel the negative impact on small businesses will be incredibly significant, while these tariffs offer no benefit to the vast majority of US citizens.

I believe it will probably lead, in conjunction with other policies, to a positive impact on the economy. There haven't been price increases, and imports haven't been stifled. If it becomes the new normal then it will probably have good effects for the budget.
Negative. It's just hurting our relationship with China while making things more expensive for US consumers. All while not making that many extra jobs for US citizens.
I think his tariff policy is a joke and only  benefits him and the wealthy. It’s having a negative effect on the economy and increasing inflation and the costs of everyday living

I believe it may be a positive impact all these years US have been paying bills to everyone allowing their people to arise from poverty. It’s time for US to do the same and rise our people from poverty. At this point 2 full time workers in the house hold are still faced with challenges to stay a float, may this will be that change we need.
From the looks of it, it's having a negative effect as most countries affected are already looking to other avenues to trade without the us
There seems to be an easy way that companies are working around the tariff policy. I don’t think it’s impacting much of anything.

The  nonsensical Trump tariffs will be largely negative for the US economy. While raising prices overall, they will not succeed in their goal of reshoring industry back to the US since the factories and supply chains have vanished and are difficult to rebuilt. Many companies are confused by the capricious tariffs and prefer to wait it out rather than invest in reshoring their operations back to America. Also, these tariffs tarnish the US's image as a fair and responsible trading partner.

A negative impact on the overall U.S. economy because companies will likely pass the cost of the tariffs onto U.S. consumers. Therefore, a lot of products are going to get a lot more expensive, which makes it harder for everyday Americans who are already struggling in today's economy. Any trade protectionist benefits will be in the far future.

The Trump administration’s tariff policy likely has mixed effects on the U.S. economy and society. While tariffs may protect certain domestic industries and jobs, they also raise costs for businesses and consumers, potentially slowing economic growth. In the long run, trade tensions could create uncertainty that negatively affects investment and global competitiveness.
Negative he doesn't understand tariffs and is using it to intimidate countries
I believe it will have a positive impact if you’re looking at the long therm goals

I believe the current tariff policy will have a negative impact on US economy. This tariff effects the consumers as businesses will have to pay the tariffs and they will in turn raise their product prices. Therefore; the consumers will be the ones paying the tariffs and paying higher prices in the end.
I believe there are going to be some negative issues in the beginning. However, in the long run, I think it’s going to be the best thing for our economy.

yes, the policy will have a positive one because  Trump says tariffs will encourage US consumers to buy more America. in 2025 Trump's imposed and scheduled tariffs will increase federal tax revenues by $172.1 billion, or 0.57 percent of GDP, making the tariffs the largest an-made goods, increase that the amount of tax raised and boost investment.PWBM projects Trump's tariffs (April 8, 2025) will reduce long-run GDP by about 6% and wages by 5%. A middle-income household faces a $22K lifetime loss

I believe it will have a negative impact on the overall U.S. economy and society. I believe certain industries will benefit, while others will suffer. Overall, I believe it will be a neg negative impact across all industries and peoples.

What I see is that most economists are concerned about what will happen to the economy. I agree with them since I'm not a specialist in this field. I think we are heading toward a recession, and the general population, especially the middle class, will suffer the most.
It will have a negative impact because consumers will be the ones to go pay for the increased prices. If consumers pay more, it will lead to less spending and impacting economy overall.
Tariff policies will force citizens to spend more, worsen relations with other countries, make the economy more unstable, and cause prices to continue to rise.
This has horrible impacts on the economy. Other countries will respond with price raising there is no benefit

The tariffs that the trump administration put in place will only negatively affect the economy. This is because companies will still produce products outside of america because it's still cheaper, and choose to raise prices to counteract the tax put in place
It will be a negative impact. America is trying to cut corners, when China is ten steps ahead at innovating.

I think it will have a negative effect on the US economy because of the administration's exclusionary and aggressive approach towards it. Tariffs can be a useful tool to influence markets, but they must be done in a strategic and targeted way to avoid economic and relational damage overall. I fear Trump's antics would just push the US away into isolation and economic hardships, since the country isn't equipped to handle the manufacturing demands that his policies necessitate.
It will have a positive effect on those that time the stock market correctly. It will have a negative effect on the rest.
Reduced economy output, because studies have shown that tariffs can reduce economy output and income.

I think the tariff policies proposed against specific goods, specific countries, could be disruptive to world economy. It looks like the value of the US dollar could drop, increased prices for US consumers, and feeding into overall US inflation rate. I think the negative impacts outweigh the positive reasoning behind these tariff policies.
I think it will have a positive impact if they try to be peaceful
I think it will have a negative effect on both the economy and society. Companies are going to be frustrated and consumers aren’t going to enjoy the higher prices on imports.

Positive effect! Maybe not at first but in the end it definitely will aid our country. There is already so much more income flowing into the states because of tariffs that should of been put in place along time ago. The offset that we pay more for goods is temporary, I feel the tariffs should again of been put in place a long time ago.

Trump's tariff policy will have a horrible impact on the U.S. economy and society. It has already begun to have an extremely negative effect, and many companies have paused trade with the U.S. These idiotic policies have affected my small business, and all they are doing is isolating the U.S. from global trade. They are completely moronic and the American people will not benefit from them.

I think that the current tariff policy under the Trump administration has a mixed impact on the US economy. Prices should be going down - however, jobs are still not hiring, prices have increased, and budget cuts haven’t proven to be effective yet. On the positive side, the budget cuts are projected to alleviate the national deficit - but we still have to see about that.

I feel like it will have more of a negative impact on the U.S. economy because it is essentially putting a strain on between the U.S. and other countries. It will also cause the U.S. citizens to pay more for products they want or need that the U.S. does not yet have the resources to make. It will take quite some time for the U.S. to get all set up and sourced to not need products from outside of the United States if it ever happens.
Tariffs will make our great products more competitive in the market. It will help boost our economy.

It going to have a negative effect.  In layman's terms it a tax on the people, because the tariffs won't be absorbed by the companies, it will be pushed unto the consumers in the form of higher taxes. Also it doesn't really encourage bringing businesses to the USA they'll wait it out.   It's the consumers who will feel the pinch of the tariffs.

I think it will have a positive effect. The main reason is it will bring world attention to the situation; the world needs to know how some nations have taken advantage of the US...that's not to say the US hasn't done the same.

I think the tariffs will have a negative impact on the economy. The reason I say that is because it will cause other countries to impose tariffs on the U.S. and that will end up negatively impacting free trade.

I think that the current tariff policy under the Trump administration is negatively affecting small businesses. When it comes to the overall US economy and society, I think that it will negatively affect that as well.
The tariff policy already has a negative effect. Prices for most of non-national goods have gone up, and prices for national goods are also up. In addition, the jobs have plateued entirely.
I don't think it's a positive thing. We, the people, are going to suffer the consequences of his decisions.

I think the tariff policy under trump will have a severely negative impact on the us economy. My package from aboard is already being delay or cancel. This increase in tariff will make trading internationally harder to do.
I think negative short term as we have seen. In the future it may lead to some better deals between countries and the U.S. that will moderately boost the economy.

I think it is negative on the economy because it cost consumers more money for everyday goods. I think it is negative for society because it portrays the US as the worlds bully putting tariffs on almost every country.

I think the current tariff policy will definitely have a negative impact. Everything is going to be expensive and the poor will just get poorer. Instead of encouraging people to buy things manufactured in the U.S., most of us won’t even be able to afford them.

I think it will have a negative impact on the overall economy as we can already see. Increasing price just makes life much tougher for majority of people. Bringing jobs back to the US is a good cause but it will take years and during those years, US citizens will suffer from high price of the tariff.

I don't feel like anything is going good under the Trump administration. There's never a deal going down with the countries that anyone is satisfied between the countries on a deal. The prices are still increase for consumer goods, gases, etc.

I believe it will have a negative impact. With the tariffs since trump came in office, it already has shown a negative impact on the U.S. economy. Prices have gone up a ton on everything that is essential to living.

I think the current tariff policy under the Trump administration will have a negative impact on the U.S. economy because many small businesses get their product and resources from overseas, China to be specific. I've been personally affected because the tariffs are so high that I can't order a lot of keychains, stickers, and other art products for my small art business anymore.
It will have a negative effect because other countries will be retaliatory against the United States, which will lead to chaos.

I think overall the tariffs will be a net negative to the economy. I think whatever gains there are won't be felt by the average person, as everything will get more expensive. Many will not receive adequate pay raises. I think many businesses will go under as well. I do not think the tariffs are sustainable.

The current tariff policy under the Trump administration is already having a negative impact on U.S. economy and society and will continue to do so unless changed. Everything is more expensive now that us, the consumers have to pay for the tariffs. Most things we buy in stores are not American made so it feels like everything is more expensive and many companies are also adding on tariff tax on goods because of Trump and his administration.

Honestly, I think the tariffs might help a few U.S. industries, but overall they make stuff more expensive and slow things down. Feels like the downsides outweigh the upsides for the economy and everyday people.

I feel tariffs are just a way for the people at the top to make money and hurt other countries and their own citizens in the process whether intentional or not. But with the Trump administration it is very intentional. Making Canada and other countries have to pay insane prices for goods when we could try to reach a common ground instead of a war through trade.
I think a negative impact because the cost of goods are already high tariffs are going to make them even higher and how is Tariffs helping us as citizen that's the million dollar question.

It will have a negative impact on overall US economy and society.  These tariffs will eventually be passed on to the the US consumers.  Also, these tariffs negotiations and grandstanding will erode away the American soft power around the globe.

Negative impact overall. The tariffs will raise prices which will lower consumer spending which would have a negative impact on the economy. plus, corporations and such will be more hesitant to invest in US businesses simply because of the unpredictable nature of the tariffs and trump’s behavior

The Trump administration's tariff policy will have a huge negative impact on U.S. society and the economy. People cannot purchase goods as prices increase drastically. Grocery prices will increase further. This will decrease the buying power of ordinary Americans and lead to inflation. The quality of life will decrease, and many can go hungry, especially if Trump eliminates SNAP food assistance.
negative impact, because Tariffs are paid by US companies to import foreign goods, with those costs eventually being paid by US consumers.

Despite my initial concerns, the Trump administration's tariff policy seems to be having good effects in most cases.  However, I think free trade in North America is a great policy.  With some modifications I think the policy will be positive.
It will have a negative effecr on the overall economy. It creates an increase in prices  for the average American and will eventually cause a recession.
In the short run, it will be negative for sure. The trade decifit is real and growing, the tariffs will eventually narrow these trade gaps which will strengthen the economy.
negative and the poeple that support it are dumb sheep to be used by the government.
It'll definitely have a negative impact, making daily purchases more expensive. I also think tariffs will prevent our allies from importing their products to our country, such as Australia and Japan.
The tariffs will have a negative impact on the US economy. People will have less money to spend. People will start hoarding more money.

I think it will have tremendous positive effects in the near future, it is already having huge positive effects in bringing in additional billions of dollars to the treasury and once adjustments are made and things settle down it will be an even bigger success for the country.

It is frightening to have these tariffs. Our prices will be higher, and we will not receive any of the tariff money, yet somehow, this will make our country more money and improve the economy...we are told. I am very uncomfortable with that answer. However, I feel I must accept it and still trust in our president.

I think short term it will definitely be negative. I think long term it could eventually be positive if the goal is to make American products instead of importing which I assume would cost less down the line.

I think it will have a terribly negative impact. Already you can see cases where average citizens struggle to receive or send packages of their choosing out of no fault of their own. And, broadly, Companies and businesses of all sizes have had their bottom line impacted very negatively thus far.
Extremely negative.  It is already costing the consumer increased costs.  Companies will go bankrupt.
In my honest opinion I think that the policy will hurt the us in the short term. I think that in the long term it would have a positive benefit later.
It will have a positive effect as it has never made sense that the US pays all these tariffs to other countries and we have never had any. Its time for it to be a fair playing field.

I think that it will have a negative impact. When tariffs are placed, I believe that the costs of imported goods will increase drastically as well, and I see this being the case under the Trump administration.
I don't know much about it.  My opinion is that it would be bad for the US economy.  It might be good for some people who aren't affected by price increases, but I can barely afford stuff as it is.

Extremely negative. They don't know what they're doing for anything and especially the economy. The tariffs are absolutely horrible! It will continue raising prices on everything and the consumer has no choice but to take the hit!

TARIFF policy under the Trump administration will have a negative impact. These are not target tariffs but blanket universal tariffs. It incentivizes our current trading partners to look else where that is cheaper or does not have tariffs.

I think negative overrall. I work in the logistics/courier package industry, and i am seeing the volume of orders decrease, which in turns affects the amount of work available to drivers. Customers are more hesitant to purchase what were once cheap products because the prices have steadily increased, with import duties sometimes being as high as $300 USD. The seller often will not pay those duties. The burden then falls on the customers, not the companies.

Tough question but it surely has made some companies buy in bulk before tariff's was implemented which tells you alot of what you need to know. It has been alot more costly for some companies but it has also allowed in some portions to keep jobs in the U.S.
I think it will have a negative impact all over the world especially in the U.S the inflation and the price of goods already high, it will make the situation very difficult for everyone.

I think it will have a negative impact on the overall economy and society. A lot of people and small businesses are already struggling, and this will only make it harder to afford essentials which can lead to greater societal problems.
Very negative. These policies are being used as weapons, and they are not stable. They change from day to day.
It will have a negative impact on the economy and society. The tariffs make the cost to import goods higher and companies will raise prices. Ultimately, the consumers pay the price.
I think it will have a negative impact on the US economy. The prices of everything are too high now and they are just getting higher. The tariffs make it even harder to get by these days.
I think the tariff policy is not the best idea. It raises prices for everything that is being shipped from overseas when they could be cheaper.

I think negative overrall. I work in the shipping/package courier industry and I'm seeing the volume of packages decrease which in turn has decreased work for drivers. Customers are more hesitant to spend money on what were once cheap goods because prices have steadily increased. And the burden of cost falls strictly on the customers because they're the ones who end up having to pay that price, not the companies.
Everybody know that the current tariff policy under the trump administration will have a negative impact on the U.S economy and society overall.

The current tariff policy may play a positive role in protecting domestic industries and pressuring trade partners to renegotiate agreements. However, it may raise costs for businesses and consumers while disrupting global supply chains.

I believe it will have a negative impact because it would increase prices for multiple goods and people would no longer be able to afford said items and their will be less spending going on in the economy. It will also cause companies to fire more employees because of the high tariffs and many people will lose their jobs.
I think, if maintained, it’ll be a net positive by bringing back American jobs. It’ll cause immense pain in the short term
I think this will have a negative impact on the overall US economy. It will cause prices to increase on goods across the board and that will enable fewer people to buy fewer goods.
negative for the short term as prices are rising hopefully it will even out at soe poing

I believe the current tariff policy will definitely benefit our country.  Other countries that play currency manipulation (for instance, China) have been taking advantage of our nation for far too long.  Sure, the road ahead will be difficult at first, due to higher costs of imported goods.  But the money the US will make back in the long run will far surpass any temporary losses.
Yes it will have a wonderful impact for the country. It may take a year to see the benefits. But he knows what he's doing.
I think it will initially have a negative impact on the economy. However, after a short time, I think it will have a positive impact with companies lowering the costs of their goods.

I think later on overall that it will have a positive effect on our economy and society but only after we start buying things and using things made by the USA. Only after we stop relying on things made outside of the USA will this be positive for the USA
this will bring more money to the economy
Huge negative impact has already happened. The cost of food and bringing in or shipping products. If you live the USA can't buy anything outside the USA without paying heavy shipping cost
I think it will have a negative impact for the average consumer. Prices are increasing and people no longer have the same purchasing power as before.
Absolutely negative. He seems to think that the other countries will have to pay the tariffs when in fact it falls back onto the citizens basically as tax
I think it will impact the economy negatively overall. Hostility and isolation is not a great way to bring back economic and manufacturing power.

I believe it is a negative impact on the overall U.S. economy and society as already shown through merchandise. In particular, I am referring to merchandise for games where there is a clear tariff mark-up as a response to the tariff policy which doubles or even triples the cost on top of shipping.
Has a very negative affect it mashes no sense and will hurt the economy
I think it will have a positive effect on the economy by creating more jobs and making it easier for people to get better jobs
I think the tariff policy will definitely have a negative impact on the overall economy. Anything Trump lays his hands on goes downhill.
Negative overall. It forces people to buy American which honestly is inefficient. We don’t do everything the best so it makes it more expensive for everyone
I’m not sure as I see both sides can be positive or negative.  I do think we should level out our costs as a country on tariffs but need better negotiating skills than threats!
It will have a negative impact. It will make everything more expensive and people will become more stressed and frustrated.
I'm not sure. I reckon some industries will feel it harder than other. But at the end of the day, life will go on.
I believe it will have a negative impact on our economy. Many small businesses will go out of business.

It will have a positive effect, which we are already seeing in the revenue that the tariffs are generating. 
Also, it will bring back jobs that had moved overseas. 
And it will cause other nations to reduce their tariffs on US goods.
Positive impact by charging more for imports and producing more export gain

I believe that it will have a negative impact on the overall US economy and society since this country is driven by corporations. These tariffs have already started many corporations to raise their prices in expecting to pay for these tariffs. The minimum wage is already horrible for people, but now they're expected to pay more for goods just because these corporations don't want to solely front the cost.
I believe that current tariff policies will have a negative effect on the US. This will likely lead to higher prices for US consumers and strained relationships with global trade partners.
I think the tariff policy will have an overall negative impact on the economy.  I think the increased cost will eventually get passed down to the consume making things more expensive.
It will and is having a negative impact on the US economy. It is causing inflation to get worse.
It's going to be a adjustment for all but it's our future
Positive because trump is for the people and he got those stimulus checks out and made us super happy with free money to everyone at least 1200-1600$ was super awesome
I think it will have a negative impact. It decreases economic efficiency. Decreases US soft power. It seems to have high inflationary effects.
Definitely gone be a negative impact

I think it will have an overall negative impact on the US economy because many people, including small businesses and small artists, rely on shipping their goods from China. I'm a small artist who orders keychains of my own art from China, and the tariffs have made it more difficult.
A positive effect. I think because the USA will take the tariff money and use the profits to make the USA stronger again.

It will have a hugely negative impact. The taxes of every consumer have been raised. Corporate profits will go down, purchasing will go down. We will be insulated more from the world. They elect a dumbass they get dumbass ideas.
It will have a very negative impact. Tariffs are taxes and these are massive
Negative, consumers will ultimately get squeezed. Only industries where US products are priced similarly to foreign products will benefit. These are a fraction of the overall economy.
I think it will have a negative impact on the economy. I am not entirely too sure about it.
I think it will most likely have a negative impact on the economy as prices will continue to increase. Making it harder for shoppers to afford items so they’ll buy less.
I strongly believe it will have a positive impact.. I can already see an improvement in the economy.
t has a negative short term effect as companies are structuring to adapt to this, its naturaly that it will not do well in the beginning, but long term it will have astoundingly positive effects
I think it will have an overall positive effect. It will end up making businesses bring production back to the United States.

The Trump administration’s tariff policy raises costs on imported goods, which can protect some domestic industries but often leads to higher prices for consumers and businesses. While certain sectors like steel or aluminum may benefit in the short term, others, especially agriculture and manufacturing reliant on global supply chains, face losses from retaliatory tariffs and rising input costs. Overall, the policy creates economic uncertainty, with mixed results that lean more negative for long-term growth and household purchasing power.

Tariffs are absorbed by consumers, which mean consumer prices will become higher and raise inflation. Inflation above a certain amount (2% something is considered by economists to be optimal) depresses the economy, as consumers are deterred by the higher costs which then would affect manufacturing.
I feel like they know more about what they are doing than I know, so I trust them and that it will work out in our favor. If it does not, then atleast we didn't let them cheat the USA
Short term negative affects, i.e., increased prices, shortages etc., but long term positive affects, more stable prices, decrease on foreign goods and increased manufacturing state side.

Overall it will have a positive impact on the overall U.S. economy and society because we have been way overbalanced in favor of foreign countries and sacrificing our wellbeing for theirs. We needed an intervention and it will hurt for awhile but be good in the long run.
it will be positive, prices will lower
Negative because it's raising prices. It's to the point nobody can afford it.
It will have a negative impact on the people of this country. Prices will rise, further than they already have.

I think it will have a positive impact. Other countries have taken advantage of the US for too long.
I think it will have a positive effect on the economy as it will generate more revenue and boost domestic products. This is a way to give our citizens more profit.

I believe it will have a positive impact for the most part. I am slightly worried it could make other countries also put tarrifs on us though.

I think for a while it will have a negative impact. I believe prices will go up.

I think it will have a negative impact on the overall U.S. economy because it will raise prices on a lot of American products. Society will also have a negative impact because people will not be able to provide for these goods and have less opportunities for themselves.
Negative.  I think it will increaase prices on everything.  Consumers, sadly, will keep spending.
I think it will have an extremely negative impact on the economy. Countries will not want to do business with us and they will raise their tariffs also.

Tariffs are taxes on us.  The Trump Admin is definitely hurting our economy and our relationships with other countries.   It is very bad.

It'll impact both economy and society, at first it will hurt economy with rising cost. But slowly it will be positive for society as importers won't have the free or low tariff anymore to take advantage.
Negative, because I don't think there's enough time for an economic policy to have an impact before another administration comes in and changes in.
I believe it will have a negative impact overall because the costs of tariffs is passed on to the consumer, not the country the tariffs are on.
Negative effect as companies are going to pass the increase to consumers. Its going to hurt consumers. Prices are going to go up and it might push America. Products at a much higher cost.

I believe that America will be a lot better off once everybody quits their whining and complaining about the tariffs and they allow it across the way that it’s supposed to be so that we can have more manufacturing and more employment here in the United States instead of abroad.

I’m honestly very unsure, social media throws so much information out there I don’t know what to believe. It is bad because stuff I want to buy is more expensive now. However this will lead people to buy more inside the US

It is a negative. It is a tax on US citizens at a time when people are increasingly having trouble making ends meet.
Negative impact. Prices will increase and people will end up buying less.
I think it will have a negative effect. Free trade is important to success. Tariffs make products more expensive for us, and gains jobs in sectors that pay poorly.

It will have a negative impact on the economy.  He changes his mind on the fly and business need stability in economic conditions.  He also attacking our current allies which will cause the rest of the world to make deals together to exclude the US.

I think it will likely have a negative overall impact on the U.S economy. Many of the people who were for the tariffs were under the false impression that the other countries would be the ones paying the increase. It's paid by U.S importers, that then raise prices for consumers to make up the difference. Tariffs are supposed to incentivize buying and producing within the US, but we don't have the manufacturing ability in this case, or a workforce willing to go through what workers in say, china, go through.
I think it will be more negative because it will cause prices to go up
It will have a negative effect on the us economy.  Prices will go up and it hurts our standing with other countries.

I think it will have a positive impact. I think it may seem like things are getting worse but sometimes things have to get worse before they get better. But I believe we will end up making money or at least saving from spending so much of international tariffs and the price of things will go down.
It will be positive. Things might be more expensive, but they will help stimulate jobs and the American economy.
The impact of tariffs will be negative. Prices are going up and wages are staying the same. Tariffs will absolutely send us into a recession.
It will have a negative impact by raising prices. Governmental revenue will be shifted to consumers and away from wealth holders.
It's already negative. Consumer prices are triple. Food is outrageous. Shortages are coming. At least we're Great Again. Satan is in the White House.

Its already affecting the economy with products going up and uncertainty.

It will have a negative effect. It will affect every part of our daily lives. People will have less disposable income.

I think it will have a negative impact because it's the US companies and then the US consumer who have to pay extra. So the tariffs won't help us.
I believe it will have a negative impact because all the prices will go up and people won't be able to afford anything.
I feel it will be a negative impact because there is more of personal war against China. I feel we should think logical with the tariff policy to make it fair across the nation

It will mostly have negative impact in the short term because the US had outsourced too much of its manufacturing. But, it will have a positive effect in the long term as American companies begin to rely more on resources and manufacturing things here in the US.
It may be good for some but I haven't heard nothing but negative things about the tariffs. Food was already at an all time high and now it's steady going up.

I think it will have a negative impact because it is raising the price of mostly everything. The tariff policy under the Trump administration likely had a negative impact on the U.S. economy and society. While intended to protect domestic industries, the tariffs led to higher costs for consumers and businesses, disrupted supply chains, and triggered retaliatory measures from trading partners. These effects contributed to economic uncertainty and reduced overall efficiency in the marketplace.

I believe the shifts are too radical not to have a negative impact. The Trump administration’s tariff policy is more likely to have a negative overall impact, as higher import costs drive up prices for consumers and disrupt global supply chains. While certain industries, like steel and aluminum, may benefit from temporary protection, others—such as agriculture and manufacturing—face retaliatory tariffs that reduce competitiveness abroad. In the long run, these trade tensions risk slowing economic growth and straining relationships with key global partners.
